page.title: 06Traditions of Hungerford.
page.content: Residents of 99 houses in the High Street in Hungerford are known as commoners and have commoners rights.From these 2 Tutti men are selected and it is their duty on Tutti day to tour commoners' houses carrying the tutti pole which is decorated with flowers.At each residence oranges are exchanged for a drink and a kiss from the lady of the house. The custom originates from the tything men who had to collect fines from commoners who had not attended court.The pole was a nose gay because some of the houses smelled badly. Another high office is that of Constable who presides over the Hocktide Court where changes are made in Commoners rights.Hungerford still boasts an official ale taster and a town crier so the old traditions look set to continue for many years to come
